e="preserve">On 17 October 2018, a bomb attack and school shooting happened in the dining room of Kerch Polytechnic College in Kerch, Crimea. The school is attended by students aged 15 to mid-20s. 19 people died and over 53 were injured, 12 of them critically.
The shooter was 18-year-old student Vladislav Roslyakov, who after the attack killed himself. A survivor said the shooting lasted 15 minutes.
The crime is being investigated as a mass murder and not terrorist attack.
Russian President Vladimir Putin described the attack as a "tragic event" and offered his condolences to the victims' families while attending a conference in Sochi.
Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko expressed condolences to the victims, whom he described as Ukrainian citizens.
